name: Procedures
description: The Procedures segment (PR1) contains information about patient procedures including surgical procedures, therapeutic procedures, and diagnostic procedures. This segment is essential for clinical documentation, billing, quality reporting, and care coordination. It provides detailed procedure coding using standard medical coding systems.

cardinality.note: PR1 provides procedure details when procedures are performed

PR1.1.name: Set ID - PR1
PR1.1.description: This field contains the set ID for the PR1 segment. It is used to identify different PR1 segments within a message.
PR1.1.generationHint: Sequential number starting at 1 for each procedure

PR1.2.name: Procedure Coding Method
PR1.2.description: This field contains the coding method used for the procedure code in PR1.3.

PR1.3.name: Procedure Code
PR1.3.description: This field contains the actual procedure code using the coding method specified in PR1.2.
PR1.3.generationHint: Use appropriate procedure code with description

PR1.4.name: Procedure Description
PR1.4.description: This field contains a free text description of the procedure.

PR1.5.name: Procedure Date/Time
PR1.5.description: This field contains the date and time when the procedure was performed.
PR1.5.generationHint: Format: YYYYMMDDHHMMSS for precise procedure timing

PR1.6.name: Procedure Functional Type
PR1.6.description: This field indicates the functional type or purpose of the procedure.
PR1.6.generationHint: A=Anesthesia, D=Diagnostic, E=Emergency, L=Laboratory, P=Primary, T=Therapeutic

PR1.7.name: Procedure Minutes
PR1.7.description: This field contains the duration of the procedure in minutes.

PR1.8.name: Anesthesiologist
PR1.8.description: This field identifies the anesthesiologist who provided anesthesia for the procedure.

PR1.9.name: Anesthesia Code
PR1.9.description: This field contains the code for the type of anesthesia used during the procedure.

PR1.10.name: Anesthesia Minutes
PR1.10.description: This field contains the duration of anesthesia in minutes.

PR1.11.name: Surgeon
PR1.11.description: This field identifies the primary surgeon who performed the procedure.
PR1.11.generationHint: Primary surgeon identifier in XCN format

PR1.12.name: Procedure Practitioner
PR1.12.description: This field identifies other practitioners involved in the procedure.
PR1.12.generationHint: Additional practitioner identifier in XCN format

PR1.13.name: Consent Code
PR1.13.description: This field indicates the type of consent obtained for the procedure.

PR1.14.name: Procedure Priority
PR1.14.description: This field indicates the priority level of the procedure.
PR1.14.generationHint: E=Emergency, R=Routine, S=Stat, T=Timing Critical, U=Urgent

PR1.15.name: Associated Diagnosis Code
PR1.15.description: This field contains diagnosis codes associated with or justifying the procedure.

PR1.16.name: Procedure DRG Type
PR1.16.description: This field indicates the DRG type used for procedure classification.

PR1.17.name: Tissue Type Code
PR1.17.description: This field contains codes for tissue types involved in the procedure.

PR1.18.name: Procedure Identifier
PR1.18.description: This field contains a unique identifier for the specific procedure instance.

PR1.19.name: Procedure Action Code
PR1.19.description: This field indicates what action is being taken with this procedure record.

notes: PR1 segments are essential for clinical documentation and billing workflows
Procedure codes must align with current coding standards (CPT, ICD-10-PCS, HCPCS)
Multiple PR1 segments may be used for multiple procedures during a single encounter
Timing information is critical for surgical scheduling and resource allocation
Anesthesia details support billing and clinical continuity requirements
Associated diagnosis codes justify medical necessity for procedures
Practitioner identification ensures proper crediting and liability tracking

dataConsistency.procedureCodeMethod: PR1.2 and PR1.3 must use compatible coding systems
dataConsistency.timingValidation: PR1.5 should align with visit dates and scheduling
dataConsistency.anesthesiaCoherence: PR1.8, PR1.9, PR1.10 should be consistent when anesthesia is used
dataConsistency.practitionerValidation: All practitioner fields should use valid provider identifiers

businessRules.codingCompliance: Procedure codes must be current and billable
businessRules.consentRequirements: Invasive procedures typically require documented consent
businessRules.anesthesiaDocumentation: Surgical procedures often require anesthesia details
businessRules.diagnosisJustification: Procedures should have supporting diagnosis codes

messageFlow.workflow: Usually accompanies ADT messages or stands alone in procedure-focused messages
